meanings.sent1: The loud music may displease some neighbors.
meanings.sent2: Her actions did not displease her parents.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to eat the new food seemed to displease its owner.
meanings.sent4: The constant delays began to displease even the most patient passengers.
meanings.sent5: The chef's decision to change the recipe displease the regular customers.

meanings.definition: To fail to satisfy or meet expectations
meanings.sent1: The simple meal may displease those expecting a fancy dinner.
meanings.sent2: His performance did not displease the audience.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick to make the rabbit disappear seemed to displease the children.
meanings.sent4: The lack of progress began to displease the project manager.
meanings.sent5: The new design changes displease the loyal customers.
